document_title: Influenza A H5N1: Symptoms, causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: cum-a-h5n1.json_2_How is influenza A H5N1 transmitted?
subsection_content:
The H5N1 virus can infect and cause illness in humans when we come into contact with infected poultry without protective measures. Person-to-person transmission is very rare. According to the US Food and Agriculture Organization, there are a number of things that can make us sick, such as:
Contact and touch sick poultry; Touching or inhaling diseased poultry secretions; Contact (slaughtering, processing with infected meat sources; Eating undercooked poultry or eggs
Processing virus-infected poultry is one of the routes of H5N1 transmission
